attributes.action: amend the Building Regulations to require all new dwellings to use recycled rain water to flush wc's.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We need  3,000,000 new homes by 2020
We are getting  more rainfall
New reservoirs  cost  £ billions - paid by all domestic water users
Environment Agency/Water Authorities agree the amount of expensively treated drinking water flushed down wc’s is 47 % of water used in dwellings
The government document “Building Regulations– Energy efficiency requirements for new dwellings - a forward look to ….  2010-13.” has no mention of water recycling but suggests saving water by lowering water pressure thus less water through taps
The South East Regional Plan wants water saving by metering - penalising the least able to pay
Rain water recycling is the only sustainable way to save expensively treated drinking water
Recycling greywater is more difficult and requires regular costly maintenance - rain recycling maintenance is easier and cheap 
Recycling rain water in new dwellings will save money for ALL dwellings as there will be fewer new reservoirs
Not building reservoirs will also save open countryside
.
